DataElement.preferredName: EORTC QLQ-C30 Version 3.0 19 Past Week Pain Has Interfered With Daily Activity Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated perception of how often in the past week pain interfered with daily activities, using a four point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: EORTC QLQ-C30 Past Week Pain Has Interfered With Daily Activity Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 30-item questionnaire about patient ability to function, symptoms related to the cancer and its treatment, overall health and quality of life, and perceived financial impact of cancer and its treatment._A survey question about whether a person has or had pain that interfered with normal work or activities._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: The European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30)
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 30-item questionnaire about patient ability to function, symptoms related to the cancer and its treatment, overall health and quality of life, and perceived financial impact of cancer and its treatment.

Concepts.longName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire Core 30
Concepts.definition: A 30-item questionnaire about patient ability to function, symptoms related to the cancer and its treatment, overall health and quality of life, and perceived financial impact of cancer and its treatment.

Property.preferredName: Past Week Pain Has Interfered With Normal Work or Activities Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:A survey question about whether a person has or had pain that interfered with normal work or activities.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.longName: Pain Has Interfered with Normal Work or Activities
Concepts.definition: A question about whether a person has or had pain that interfered with normal work or activities.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Alliance per request by K.Allen-Ziegler. mc 2/4/13  Released per approval. mc 2/15/13

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (Not at All) to 4 (Very Much) on a Likert scale used on EORTC questionnaires.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did pain interfere with your
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did pain interfere with your daily activities?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure.  The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.  Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Medidata ePRO CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This CDE has been validated for use with the Medidata Rave ePRO module.
